reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked thru hotel.de. We had no problems with our reservation especially since I booked just around 2 weeks before our stay.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: We loved the free mini bar which they refilled everyday. Staying here during winter made me and my husband very thirsty so having that minibar was a definite plus. They stocked it with 1 bottle of water, 2 bottles German beer, 2 bottles orange juice, 2 bottles Pepsi, 2 bottles soda water. The room was old, but clean and spacious. They still used the old key system but the room had 2 doors so you can close both doors if you're worried about security. I didn't encounter any unwanted elements although we didn't really stay out late at night as it was very cold and most of the shops closed at 7:30pm.
reviews.title: Central Location and Free Extras! Recommended.

likes.liked: — The location and the extras like free minibar, free internet and free local calls...
likes.disliked: — The lack of refined interior finishes, airconditioning/heating (portable :()

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast offered included cold cuts, bratwurst, bread, rice, dumplings, eggs, cereal, salmon, fruits, yogurt, juices, coffee and tea. They didn't refill the items right away tho'. The hot milk for the hot chocolate ran out and it was just 9am. Dumplings and rice weren't refilled either.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: The problem we encountered happened on the second night when the guest on the adjacent room turned on his television at 1AM. It was too loud and we couldn't sleep. He did turn the volume down after an hour so we were able to sleep then. I don't know if the walls were thin or his TV was too loud but that definitely put a damper in our stay.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, highly recommended

likes.disliked: — area is a bit seedy but no reflection on hotel

reviews.text: The other negative thing was they had their own magazine with a sex feature right on the front cover. Definitely would not recommend this if you have kids with you.
reviews.title: Nice experience

reviews.text: I stayed at Monopol hotel for 3 nights in January 2006, so here are my impressions.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with pros and cons
Fine for a night or two; nice amenities
reviews.text: Positive:

+ Location. It's exactly opposite the south exit of the Central Train Station (Hauptbahnhoff), so all trains, metro etc. are at your feet. Inside the station there's an amazing variety of food, snacks and drinks to heal your hunger and quench your thirst (incl. McDonald's, Burger King, Starbucks and Haagen Dazs).
reviews.title: Very good value for price
Monopol Frankfurt - Great value for single or family
reviews.text: + Neighbourhood. Let's face it. Like in every major city, the areas around train stations gather all sorts of individuals and naturally they aren't the favorite places to hang out, so one should be careful and mind their own business as well. However I had no problems whatsoever, even when walking to the hotel past midnight. Also the main street is very well lit and outside the hotel's entrance there's a taxi rank with the cabbies waiting inside their cars.

reviews.title: Faded grandeur
reviews.text: + Check-in. Quick, professional and efficient, from 9 in the morning. This is a pleasant surprise, especially if you arrive with a morning flight. No need to wait till the afternoon for your room. Everyone in the staff speaks English too. You have to carry your luggage to the room on your own, but there are two elevators and no up and down stairs so no problem.
Myself and 2 members of my family spent 3 nights in the Monopol which was booked through a travel agent as part of a Formula 1 package.
reviews.title: This is not a Four Star Hotel!

reviews.text: The hotel is advertised as 4 star however this rating is very misleading. The room was clean and house keeping did a very nice job but there is no air conditioning in this hotel. The heat in the hotel was stifling, so much so that we abandoned the room during the day for the comfort of air conditioned shops and restaurants. The small electric fan they gave us did not provide much comfort at night time either and we had to leave the window open all night just for a little air! This is ok if your room is at the back of the hotel but the front of the hotel faces the extremely busy central station which, as you can imagine, is very noisy.
reviews.title: If you're coming by train, it's a great location!

reviews.text: The Monopol also boasts about their 'free cakes and tea available all day'. This consists of a table laid out opposite reception with a couple of plastic jugs full of tea which is always cold. Breakfast was quite nice but I would not eat at the hotel for dinner as there was not a good selection and the food was quite pricey.
reviews.title: Hotel with no atmosphere

reviews.text: The area around the hotel is very dirty and we did not feel comfortable leaving the hotel after dark. If you are expecting to catch a glimpse of picturesque German streets you will need to take a train or taxi to another part of town.
reviews.title: Great Value!
beside central station
reviews.text: There is no atmosphere in this hotel and the front desk staff aren't particularly helpful either. If you want to see Frankfut on a budget, this hotel might be a good option but if you are expecting Four Star standards you will be very disappointed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is rather dated which really does add to its charm. It is located directly across the street from the main train station which means you can make it to the airport in 15 minutes which was perfect for us who had an early monring flight.
reviews.title: Good Value with Lots of Extras - Great for Train and Airport Access
Good value for your money
reviews.text: Our room (169) was huge with high ceilings. The bathroom was also large with two sinks. Furnishings and fittings are old, but have been cared for in a bit of a hodge-podge way.
The hotel really throws amenities at its guests - hot breakfast buffet that runs from early to late morning, free min-bar with beer, water, and soda, free afternoon coffeee and cake.
reviews.title: Nice stay at the Monopol

reviews.text: Nothing fancy, but a good value.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: Minibar is free :-))
reviews.title: Fantastic
